intro: Boehmeria caudata var. celebica, commonly known as the Celebes nettle, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes various species of nettles. The plant is characterized by its hairy, lance-shaped leaves and small greenish-white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and swamps. Its fibrous stems have been used traditionally for making textiles and paper.
